page.title: 10Landscaped Cemetery
page.content: On the 20th of June I went with a group to tour Cockermouth Cemetery. I know it is a tourist attraction as it is more of a landscaped park than a burial place. The manager showed us records in his office. First record: June 1856 and 133 burials in that year. 1985: 35_50 predicted. In the years of 'flu epidemics coffins were brought by horse and cart for burial by lantern. He took us round. We saw 20 varieties of trees, limes,flowering cherries,yew copper beech and holly. As the seasons change there are carpets of snowdrops, crocuses,miniature daffodils,primroses down by the beck. The old part has few headstones. Most ornate is that of a Travelling Fair man known locally as "Biddall", who died at Cockermouth Fair. The new ground extension will be consecrated by the Bishop in 1987.
